name: Lord
description: Historically, most characters of the Lord class are either the main protagonist or otherwise central to the game's narrative.

name: Mercenary
description: The Mercenary is an infantry class that recurrently appears across the Fire Emblem series. Historically, this class wields Swords as its sole weapon of choice.

name: Hero
description: In a majority of its iterations, the Hero class is the promoted form of the Mercenary class.

name: Thief
description: Wielding Swords or Knives as their weapons of choice, the primary role of Thieves is to Steal and manipulate locks imposed on doors and chests.

name: Fighter
description: A physical combat class found most games in the series, Wielding Axes as their sole weapon of choice.

name: Archer
description: Archers are foot soldiers carrying Bows to launch assaults on their foes at range.

name: Sniper
description: The promoted form of the Archer class, Snipers wield Bows as their weapon of choice. While not particularly different from normal Archers, the Sniper class is open to more advanced bows.

name: Cavalier
description: The Cavalier is a horse-mounted combat physical class that is usually capable of arming either Lances or Swords as its weapons of choice.

name: Paladin
description: Commonly the promoted form of the Cavalier class, the equipment armed by the Paladin class varies depending on the title.

name: Knight
description: Often wielding Lances as their sole weapon of choice, Knights are generally hampered by low Movement and compensate for this with their good physical stats across the board and strong defense.

name: General
description: The General class is defined by superior offense and defense alongside a fairly decent evasive ability for their bulk, which is offset by the class's low movement.

name: Pegasus Knight
description: Historically a female-only class, Pegasus Knights are warriors riding atop flying Pegasus steeds who most commonly wield lances.

name: Wyvern Rider
description: This class features warriors soaring into battle atop the backs of Wyverns, and are usually armed with Lances and/or Axes as their primary weapons of choice.

name: Mage
description: A combat magical class that recurrently appears across the series, primarily arming themselves with Anima magic as their weapon of choice.

name: Priest
description: Mainly intended for support purposes, Priests are only capable of aiding allies with the power of staves and are unable to directly attack.

name: Bishop
description: The traditional promoted form of the Priest, Monk and Cleric classes, the Bishop class usually wields Light magic as its primary weapon of choice, and is also armed with Staves for support purposes.

name: Manakete
description: Manaketes are members of the Dragon Tribe who had sealed their true dragon forms into their Dragonstones, and then live the rest of their long-lives in a human form, only temporarily reassuming their true forms for fighting.

name: Myrmidon
description: Wielding Swords as their sole weapon of choice, the Myrmidon class is distinct from the similar Mercenary class, but closely linked to it in terms of origins and promotion paths.

name: Soldier
description: The Soldier is a combat physical class that has appeared sometimes playable and sometime as an enemy-only class. The class traditionally uses Lances as their sole weapon of choice.

name: Bow Knight
description: Bow Knight is a horse-mounted combat physical class primarily armed with bows as its weapon of choice.

name: Sage
description: The original promoted form of the Mage class in several titles, the Sage class wields Anima magic as its primary weapon of choice, alongside staves for support purposes.

name: Falcon Knight
description: One of the promoted forms of the Pegasus Knight class, Falcon Knights commonly wield Lances and Swords as their weapons of choice.

name: Cleric
description: A female-exclusive class, the Cleric is unable to engage in combat, instead filling support roles by using Staves to heal their allies.

name: Dancer
description: A Dancer unit possesses the unique ability to utilize the Dance command on an allied unit who has taken an action that turn, allowing them another full turn of movement and action.

name: Dark Mage
description: Wielding Dark magic as their primary weapon of choice, Dark Mages have exclusive access to dark magic spells such as Nosferatu and Mire.

name: Swordmaster
description: A promoted form of the Myrmidon class. Swordmasters, like their name suggests, are unparalleled masters of the Sword.

name: Warrior
description: A predominantly male combat physical class. The promoted form of the Fighter class, the Warrior class commonly wields Axes and Bows as its weapons of choice.

name: Troubadour
description: A horse-mounted support magical class primarily armed with staves that they utilize for healing and other support purposes.

name: Great Knight
description: Possible promotion for the Cavalier and Knight classes. The Armored incarnation is known to be able to wield Swords and Lances in addition to Axes.

name: Wyvern Lord
description: A Wyvern-mounted class that commonly wields Lances as their primary weapon of choice, and wields either Swords or Axes as their secondary weapons of choice.

name: Berserker
description: The promoted form of Axe-wielding infantry classes, the Berserker has traditionally been male-only and wields Axes as their sole weapon of choice.

name: Great Lord
description: Among classes that serve as promotions from Lord, the Great Lord class typically wields the primary weapon of its preceding Lord class, usually with a secondary weapon type added.

name: Valkyrie
description: The standard promoted form of the Troubadour class, Valkyries wield staves as their primary equipment for support purposes.

name: Assassin
description: The Assassin class acts as the promoted form of the Thief class, wielding Swords or Knives as its primary weapons of choice.

name: Sorcerer
description: The promoted form of the Dark Mage class, the Sorcerer class wields Dark Magic as its sole weapon of choice.

name: Trickster
description: Glamorous and elusive phantom thieves, Tricksters are one of the promoted forms of the Thief class, wielding Swords or Bows as their primary weapons of choice. They are also capable of utilizing Staves for support purposes.

name: Dark Flier
description: The Dark Flier class is introduced as the alternate promoted form of the Pegasus Knight class and is credited as being the pioneer flying class that is able to wield offensive magic.

name: Dark Knight
description: Known as Mage Knights in earlier titles, Dark Knights wield Tomes as their primary weapon of choice, and are also able to arm Swords as their secondary weapon.

name: War Monk
description: A class that is both physical and magical, the War Monk class takes on both combat and support roles. It is one of the promoted forms of the Priest class, employing Axes and Staves as its equipment of choice.

name: War Cleric
description: It is one of the promoted forms of both the Cleric and Troubadour classes, employing Axes and Staves as its equipment of choice. The War Cleric class is the female equivalent of the War Monk class.

name: Villager
description: A combat physical class, it is a trainee class that affords little value apart from giving units potential to grow into valuable assets of the player's army. Villagers primarily wield either Swords or Lances as their weapons of choice.

name: Dread Fighter
description: A combat physical and magical powerful Sword-wielding class noteworthy for high Resistance and skills that further boost their Resistance.

name: Light Priestess
description: A very powerful magical class that is prolific in fulfilling both combat and support roles. Wields light magic and staves.

name: Monk
description: A combat magical class that wields light magic.

name: Arch Sage
description: Masters of all types of Anima magic and Staves, certain variations of the Archsage class are also able to arm Light and Dark Magic.
